contentrichtext.text: '''[[Thomas Hardy]]''' (1840–1928), was an English novelist, short-story writer, and poet. '''Thomas Hardy''' or '''Tom Hardy''' may also refer to: ==Thomas Hardy== * [[Thomas Hardy|Thomas Hardy, OM]] 1840-1928, English novelist and poet * [[Sir Thomas Hardy, 1st Baronet]] (1769–1839), British naval officer * [[Thomas Duffus Hardy]] (1804–1878), English antiquary * [[Thomas Hardy (English painter)]] (1757–1804), English painter whose works include a portrait of Joseph Haydn * [[Thomas Hardy (minister)]] (1747–1798), Scottish minister and professor of eccesiastical history * Sir [[Thomas Hardy (MP)]] (1666–1732), Member of Parliament for [[Weymouth and Melcombe Regis (UK Parliament constituency)|Weymouth and Melcombe Regis]] * [[Thomas Hardy (political reformer)]] (1752–1832), English activist * [[Thomas Hardy (winemaker)]] (1830–1912), Australian founder of the Hardy Wine Company * [[Thomas Hardy (sculptor)]], 20th century sculptor, worked jointly at the [[Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial]] ==Tom Hardy== * [[Tom Hardy]] (born 1977), English stage, film and television actor * [[Tom Hardy (broadcaster)]] (21st century), professional radio broadcaster * [[Tom Hardy (designer)]] (born 1946), American design strategist * [[Tom Hardy Jr.]], also known as Tommy Hardy, a fictional character on the soap opera ''General Hospital'' * [[Tom Hardy Sr.]], a fictional character on the soap opera ''General Hospital'' * [[Tom Hardy (soccer)]], retired American soccer defender * A fictional character played by [[Bruce Willis]] in the 1993 film ''[[Striking Distance]]'' * A fictional character played by [[John Travolta]] in the 2003 film ''[[Basic (film)|Basic]]'' {{hndis|Hardy, Thomas}}
